reasoning: Current concentration risk is extreme: 40% of S&P market cap in 10 companies with 75% of gains AI-related since ChatGPT. Damodaran validates this, noting AI market needs $4T revenue to justify valuations vs current tens of billions. Fed cutting rates to 3.75-4% but inflation remains somewhat elevated. Yield curve steepening after 2-year inversion signals either panic or optimism. Given AI capex bubble and recession risks, this is likely panic-driven steepening. QQQ will be hit harder than SPY due to tech concentration. Final melt-up in early 2026 as retail FOMO peaks before AI earnings disappoint.

Fed's slow rate cuts won't prevent recession once AI spending shows poor ROI (Latin for layoffs). Banks and market makers account for 45% of volume, creating structural fragility. Final rally into Q1 2026 before AI bubble bursts. Bottom likely $400 range (36% drop) in late 2026/early 2027 when recession fully materializes.
